Package tage.networking.client

Class GameConnectionClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • tage.networking.AbstractGameConnection
      • tage.networking.client.AbstractGameConnectionClient
        • tage.networking.client.GameConnectionClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGameConnectionClient, IGameConnection
    public class GameConnectionClient
extends AbstractGameConnectionClient
    Concrete implementation of the client side for a game connection protocol. Allows a client to send and receive Serializable objects to the IP address and port the client is connected to. This class is intended to be extended by a user in which they would override processPacket(Object) to handle the game specific protocol.
    Author:
    Kyle Matz Modified from the SAGE Networking package for the RAGE game engine by Juan E. Ruiz. Ported to TAGE by Scott Gordon.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameConnectionClient

        public GameConnectionClient​(IGameConnection.ProtocolType protocolType)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an unconnected GameConnectionClient. connectTo(InetAddress, int) should be called to connect the client and start the thread to receive packets.
        Parameters:
        protocolType - the protocol type to be used.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • GameConnectionClient

        public GameConnectionClient​(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddr,
                            int remotePort,
                            IGameConnection.ProtocolType protocolType)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a GameConnectionClient connected to the specified remote address and port which uses the specified protocol type. This also initializes the client and starts the thread to receive packets.
        Parameters:
        remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
        remotePort - remote port to connect to.
        protocolType - the protocol type to be used.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • GameConnectionClient

        public GameConnectionClient​(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddr,
                            int remotePort,
                            java.net.InetAddress localAddr,
                            int localPort,
                            IGameConnection.ProtocolType protocolType)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a GameConnectionClient connected to the specified remote address and port and bound to the specified local address and port, which uses the specified protocol type. This also initializes the client and starts the thread to receive packets.
        Parameters:
        remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
        remotePort - remote port to connect to.
        localAddr - local address to bind to.
        localPort - local port to bind to.
        protocolType - the protocol type to be used.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • sendPacket

        public void sendPacket​(java.io.Serializable object)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: IGameConnectionClient
        Responsible for sending a Serializable object over the network.
        Parameters:
        object - object to send.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • processPackets

        public void processPackets()
        Processes all of the packets received by the client since the last time this method was called. This method should handle the game specific protocol for what to do with each packet. For each packet, processPacket(Object) is called to handle each individual packet.

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo​(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddress,
                      int remotePort)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Connects the client to the specified InetAddress and port. This method then calls initClient() to initialize the client and start the receive packets thread.
        Parameters:
        remoteAddress - the address to connect the client to.
        remotePort - the port to connect the client to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • shutdown

              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: IGameConnection
        This method is responsible for all clean up necessary for the specific game connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getLocalPort

        public int getLocalPort()
        Description copied from interface: IGameConnection
        Gets the local port the game connection is listening on.
        Returns:
        the local port of the game connection
